title: 'I need to listen to my doctors': Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu to be fitted with pacemaker
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has said he will be fitted with a pacemaker tonight.

title: Wildfires on Rhodes force hundreds of holidaymakers to flee their hotels
description: Wildfires on the Greek island of Rhodes have forced hundreds of holidaymakers to flee their hotels.

title: Paul Pogba's 'goal' to end poverty as footballer launches new fund
description: Former Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba wants to help tackle the UK's cost of living crisis, telling Sky News that ending poverty is "the goal" of a new ethical fund he is launching.

title: Dramatic hailstorm pummels Italy - days after searing heatwave
description: An icy torrent swarmed trough the streets of a town near Milan after a dramatic hailstorm in northern Italy.

title: Penalty drama helps England secure 1-0 win over Haiti in their first Women's World Cup match
description: England have won their first Women's World Cup match with a 1-0 victory over Haiti in Brisbane.

title: Two-year-old dies from brain-eating amoeba
description: A two-year-old boy has died from a brain-eating amoeba in Nevada.

title: Groups of young people scour Irish beach after large bales of suspected cocaine wash ashore
description: Groups of young people have been spotted combing an Irish beach after two large bales of suspected cocaine washed up on shore.

title: The 1975 banned from performing in Malaysia after Matt Healy kisses male bandmate on stage
description: A three-day music festival in Malaysia has been cancelled by the authorities after the frontman of The 1975 kissed a male bandmate on stage - and criticised the country's anti-LGBT laws.

title: Lionel Messi scores late winner on Inter Miami debut
description: Lionel Messi scored a dramatic goal in the 94th minute on his debut at new club Inter Miami.

title: 'We're going to give everything': Lionesses to get World Cup campaign under way
description: England are hours away from kicking off their World Cup campaign down under with their opening match against Haiti.
